name: Moevenpick Hotel 's-Hertogenbosch

reviews.text: My one an only criticism of the Mövenpick Hotel at ’s-Hertogenbosch is that it was difficult to locate. My SatNav easily got me from Schiphol Airport in Amsterdam to within a few hundred metres of the hotel. But then the frustration set in. There were no signs, that I could see, to the hotel from the main road, Gestelsweg. In fact, even the map on the right here has palce the hotel in the wrong place! It’s next to the lakeside at the other end of the street.
reviews.title: Ideal for the Business Traveller

reviews.text: Thankfully, I tend to pour-over maps of the area that I am about to travel to before I set off, and I vaguely knew where the hotel should be.
reviews.title: Ok location, OK service, for the price

reviews.text: I stumbled upon it, by accident, tucked away, almost invisibly, in the far corner of the commercial estate.
reviews.title: great hotel, poor beds, expensive

reviews.text: Sign-posting from Gestelsweg to the hotel would be highly appreciated!
reviews.title: Mediocre for the price

reviews.text: Now that the negative side of my review is over, we can focus on the hotel itself.
reviews.title: Average Hotel, Good Service, Bad Bed, Nice Shuttle
Very satisfied, as usual a pleasure to stay here
reviews.text: Stayed here already x-times and was there again at the end of September. Typicall business hotel in a business area, so a car would be an advantage, although taxi’s and public transport are available at reasonable rates. The hotel has a strategic location and within 2 minutes you are on the central highway. Very, very convenient.

reviews.title: Nothing great; nothing offensive
reviews.text: Hotel public areas are clean and welcoming, especially the lobby corner where one can sit and have his coffee in the morning without being disturbed, reading your free newspaper. Great way to wake up…!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff: Couldn’t wish for more. Always polite and they will go out of their way to assist you. After one day, they already know you by name and my guess was that the hotel was well occupied.
reviews.title: OK hotel, but horrible beds...

reviews.text: Rooms: Perfect. What more do you need when you are on a business trip? Clean, comfortable and with all facilities such as minibar, wireless internet and a TV with sufficient national and international channels. Very practical and nice bathroom. Good pressure on the shower (which is very hard to find in hotels around the world), and I just love their mascotte, the little yellow plastic bath-duck. Can’t agree with previous reviews re. the pillows and matrasses. I think they are great and most comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice hotel as long as you don't sleep there

reviews.text: Only one small default I can think of is that the service in the lobby bar corner is a bit slow and one really has to make an effort to draw the attention of the staff when you want to order your next coffee. But then again, really minor detail and the friendliness of the staff makes up for it.
reviews.title: OK business hotel but nothing special

description: Welcome to the Netherlands. Thanks to its location with excellent transport links, a state-of-the-art infrastructure and numerous conference rooms, the Mövenpick Hotel 's-Hertogenbosch is the best address when it comes to business hotels.
